abstract: Saturday Profile of Yanar Mohammed, who runs secret network of safe houses for women in Iraq; Mohammed and her Organization of Women's Freedom in Iraq are preparing for eventuality that Islamic State group will be defeated in Iraq and Syria, which will result in large numbers of women who have been abducted by group returning home only to find themselves ostracized from their families and even subjected to atrocities like honor killings.
lead_paragraph: Yanar Mohammed runs a secret network of safe houses in Iraq meant to give women a second chance, but running them did so for her.

headline.main: Finding a Path Back to Iraq, and Toward Securing Women’s Freedom
headline.print_headline: Finding a Path Back to Iraq, and Toward Securing Women’s Freedom

snippet: Yanar Mohammed runs a secret network of safe houses in Iraq meant to give women a second chance, but running them did so for her.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
